    • i

      public javax.swing.ImageIcon i

  • Constructor Details

    • DisplayPix

      public DisplayPix()

  • Method Details

    • getXval

      public int getXval()
      This method is a simple getter for the x-coordinate of the color picker. Note the name: it's getXval, not getX!
      Returns:
      color-picker x-coordinate

    • getYval

      public int getYval()
      This method is a simple getter for the y-coordinate of the color picker. Note the name: it's getYval, not getY!
      Returns:
      color-picker y-coordinate

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      This method returns the row of the color-picker. The row is calculated with respect to the buffer's and image's sizes.
      Returns:
      row of color-picker

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      This method returns the column of the color-picker. The column is calculated with respect to the buffer's and image's sizes.
      Returns:
      column of color-picker

    • getRGB

      public int getRGB​(int x, int y)
      This method returns the color of a specific pixel in the image.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the location
      y - the y-coordinate of the location
      Returns:
      pixel color

    • update

      public void update​(int xval, int yval)
      This method gets the coordinates of the color-picker, then assigns those values to the x and y variables. The method also sets the value of the "clicked" variable to true.
      Parameters:
      xval - x-coordinate of color-picker
      yval - y-coordinate of color-picker

    • zeroRed

      public void zeroRed()
      This method sets the red value of every pixel in the image to zero.

    • zeroGreen

      public void zeroGreen()
      This method sets the green value of every pixel in the image to zero.

    • zeroBlue

      public void zeroBlue()
      This method sets the blue value of every pixel in the image to zero.

    • negate

      public void negate()
      This method sets every pixel's RGB values to 255 - (current value).

    • gray

      public void gray()
      This method takes the average of the RGB values for a pixel, then sets that value as the red, green, and blue values.

    • sepia

      public void sepia()
      This method uses Microsoft's recommended formula to add a sepia tint.

    • blur

      public void blur()
      This method produces a blur effect by averaging the RGB values of surrounding pixels.

    • posterize

      public void posterize()
      This method sets the RGB values of a pixel based on which range the current values fall into:
      • 0-63, inclusive: 32
      • 64-127, inclusive: 96
      • 128-191, inclusive: 160
      • 191-255, inclusive: 224

    • splash_red

      public void splash_red()
      This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly red, i.e. their red value is greater than or equal to the sum of their green and blue values.

    • splash_green

      public void splash_green()
      This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly green, i.e. their green value is greater than or equal to the sum of their red and blue values.

    • splash_blue

      public void splash_blue()
      This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly blue, i.e. their blue value is greater than or equal to the sum of their red and green values.

    • mirrorLR

      public void mirrorLR()
      This method makes the right half of the image a mirror of the left.

    • mirrorRL

      public void mirrorRL()
      This method makes the left half of the image a mirror of the right.

    • mirrorUD

      public void mirrorUD()
      This method makes the bottom half of the image a mirror of the top.

    • mirrorDU

      public void mirrorDU()
      This method makes the top half of the image a mirror of the bottom.

    • flipLR

      public void flipLR()
      This method flips the left and right halves of the image.

    • flipUD

      public void flipUD()
      This method flips the top and bottom halves of the image.

    • pixelate

      public void pixelate()
      This method pixelates the image by creating 10x10 blocks that are all the same color.

    • sunsetize

      public void sunsetize()
      This method adds a red "sunset"-like tint by decreasing the green and blue values of every pixel.

    • redeye

      public void redeye()
      This method detects red-eye coloration and removes it.

    • edge

      public void edge()
      This method attempts to find edges based on the distances between RGB values in 3-dimensional space.

    • encode

      public void encode()
      This method encodes a message of the user's choosing within the RGB values of the image.

    • decode

      public void decode()
      This method reveals an encoded message.

    • chroma

      public void chroma()
      This method replaces a region of similar color in one image with part of another image.

    • gbr

      public void gbr()
      This method rotates the color 120 degrees clockwise on the color wheel.

    • brg

      public void brg()
      This method rotates the color 240 degrees clockwise on the color wheel.

    • adjustRed

      public void adjustRed()
      This method adjusts all red values by a specified percentage.

    • adjustGreen

      public void adjustGreen()
      This method adjusts all green values by a specified percentage.

    • adjustBlue

      public void adjustBlue()
      This method adjusts all blue values by a specified percentage.

    • adjustAll

      public void adjustAll()
      This method adjusts all RGB values by a specified percentage.

    • resetImage

      public void resetImage()
      This method removes all alterations from an image.

    • undo

      public void undo()
      This method undoes the most recent change by popping an item off the stack of images.

    • save

      public void save()
      This method saves an image to a file.

    • openImage

      public boolean openImage()
      This method attempts to open an image to be worked on.
      Returns:
      whether opening the image worked or not

    • up

      public void up()
      This method moves the color-picker up one pixel.

    • down

      public void down()
      This method moves the color-picker down one pixel.

    • left

      public void left()
      This method moves the color-picker one pixel to the left.

    • right

      public void right()
      This method moves the color-picker one pixel to the right.

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method draws the color-picker on the screen.
      Overrides:
      paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics component to draw the color-picker on
